title: Let’s Start Treating Knee Injuries Like Brain Injuries
description: Sport and health leaders would be wise to get serious now.

title: Congress Is Grappling With the Wrong Questions on Ukraine
description: The U.S. Congress is willing debate the kinds of weapons used in Ukraine but not how the war should end

title: What the Return of the ‘Morality Police’ Means For Iran’s Women
description: The decision to resume patrols comes almost a year after they largely paused their activities.

title: Mike Bloomberg’s Organization Is Guiding Hundreds of Mayors Across the Country
description: How one of America's richest men become the nation's mayoral tutor.

title: Scientists Are Just Beginning to Understand COVID-19’s Effect On the Brain
description: COVID-19 can have profound effects on the brain, leading to neurocognitive symptoms like brain fog, memory loss, and even dementia.

title: Biden Sends Trump-Appointed Hatch Act Watchdog to a New Post
description: President Biden has nominated for a new post Henry Kerner, the Trump-appointed watchdog investigator who issued warnings to two senior Biden officials over inappropriate uses of their offices for political purposes.

title: How Women’s Soccer Exploded in Britain
description: Soccer’s origin story is thought to be firmly rooted in England, but women playing the game hasn’t always been accepted there.

title: Gem Hunters Found the Lithium America Needs. Maine Won’t Let Them Dig It Up
description: Gem hunters in Maine found one of the richest lithium deposits in the U.S. State laws mean they can't mine it.

title: The Best Way to Save American Lives on the Road
description: America will be going around in circles on road safety until it adopts more traffic circles aka roundabouts

title: How the Taliban Suppressed Opium in Afghanistan—and Why There’s Little to Celebrate
description: And why that is setting up the country, and the world, for far worse consequences.

title: A Blast on a Vital Bridge Linking Russia to Moscow-Annexed Crimea Leaves 2 Dead. Here’s What to Know
description: The Kerch Bridge is a conspicuous symbol of Moscow’s claims on Crimea and an essential land link to the peninsula.

title: South Korea’s Death Toll From Destructive Rainstorm Hits 40, as Workers Search for Survivors
description: Heavy downpours lashed South Korea for a ninth day on Monday as rescue workers struggled to search for survivors.

title: Israel Presses Ahead With Plan to Weaken Courts, as More Protests Loom
description: A parliamentary committee was preparing a bill on Monday that would limit judicial oversight, ahead of mass protests.

title: What to Know About Ukraine’s Grain Deal and Its Effect on Global Food Supply
description: The fate of a wartime deal designed to move food from Ukraine to parts of the world where millions are going hungry is unclear as it faces renewal Monday.

title: Singapore’s Parliament Speaker Resigns in Latest Blow to Ruling Party
description: Singapore’s ruling People’s Action Party was rocked by two unexpected resignations, including that of parliament speaker Tan Chuan-Jin.

title: A Viral French Ad Shows How Women’s Soccer Can Be Just as Exciting as Men’s
description: Increasingly, people are starting to realize that the women’s game hasn’t been given the credit that it’s due.
